definition: Ability to establish, organize, analyze, administer, and report on all aspects of a name, symbol, or design that identifies and differentiates products, offerings, or organizational identities.
Ability to establish and identify a brand.
Ability to declare a brand.
Ability to find and recognize a brand.
Ability to organize, aggregate, segment, and prioritize a collection of brands.
Ability to determine how well a brand is meeting specification and objective levels, or delivering against plan.
Ability to determine acceptable or unacceptable levels of performance for a brand.
Ability to determine if a brand is exceeding or falling short of an acceptable threshold of performance.
Ability to assess what is causing a brand to underperform.
Ability to assess and quantify the commitment and staying power that the brand has within the markets in which it has a presence.
Ability to identify and define the level of acceptable risk associated with a customer.
Ability to consider a collective set of risk factors about a customer and represent them from a rationalized perspective.
Ability to determine that a customer is who they claim to be based on a defined confidence level.
Ability to define the degree of confidence needed to authenticate a customer for various scenarios.
Ability to ascertain the degree to which a customer is authenticated.
Ability to declare that a customer is who they claim to be.
Ability to define, determine, and assign customer access features, attributes, and characteristics.
Ability to describe the nature of customer authorization classifications for example authorization levels, ratings or categories.
Ability to ascertain authorization of a customer.
Ability to ascribe authorization to a customer.
